diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Huntington's disease with hyperglycemic chorea-ballism in type 1 diabetes mellitus
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient exhibited severe involuntary movements and was diagnosed with DKA and hyperglycemic chorea-ballism. Brain MRI revealed atrophy of the caudate nucleus characteristic of Huntington's disease, and DNA analysis confirmed HD. Recovery from involuntary movements following treatment supported the diagnosis of hyperglycemic chorea-ballism exacerbated by underlying Huntington's disease.
